awd_titl_txt: Methodological Training For a GIS Application in Cultural   Anthropology
awd_abstract_narration: This project will permit a productive senior scholar to                    gain training in GIS, a computer intensive technique                            employed to create geographic data bases that can be                            spatially manipulated.  An important part of the work will                      be developing ways in which to link ethnographic data with                      spatial data in order to deal with the problem of                               agricultural intensification in an area of Mexico that is                       economically realigning itself as a result of decline in the                    oil boom of the 1970s.  This training will allow the                            research gain methodological expertise that will permit the                     analysis of ethnographic phenomena on a regional basis, a                       major improvement over a usual narrow ethnographic                              perspective.  As a result, ethnographic trends over entire                      regions will be described in greater detail than would                          otherwise be possible and questions about regional trends                       that could not otherwise be asked without this new technique                    will be studied.  In addition, the researcher will be able                      to train graduate students in this important technique.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Behavioral and Cognitive Sciences
